page.title: 10BONE FARM ,PENZANCE .
page.content: In July we went on a school trip in six cars to Bone Farm.We went into a big field of barley.It was golden brown and waving in the wind.It was up to our waists and was going to be cut in two weeks time.We went into a cool,damp wood,with lots of Foxgloves and Deadly Nightshade.There were young Willows growing.The twigs could bend without breaking.Some people use them for making crab-pots.We enjoyed going through the potato fields. The potatoes were soon to be harvested and made into crisps.The 150 sheep were Mules and Devon Longwool. The farmhouse had a huge,old,granite log fireplace.From under the big oak tree we could see St.Michael's Mount and Mount's Bay. Les.
